intro: Orchis tharandina, commonly known as the Tharandine Orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing violet to purple flowers with a distinctive lip petal. Orchis tharandina prefers moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges or shaded meadows. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
